oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cabinet card of Pvt. William Henry Harrison Cruze, Co. E, 3rd Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. William Henry Harrison Cruze, Co. E, 3rd Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA was captured by the Confederates at Okolona, Miss. in February 1864. He was paroled to Camp Chase, Ohio in January 1865 and by March 1865 was at Camp Fisk near Vicksburg, Miss. According to family lore, Cruze lost his sight while in prison. He died on October 29, 1929 of heart failure and is buried in Woodlawn Cemetery in Knoxville, Tennessee. This is a post-war cabinet card of Cruze.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cruze, William Henry Harrison
